title: Travels in East Anglia

Mowat’s affectionate take on the Anglo-American relationship, published in 1935 under the title Americans in England. With skill and care, Mowat managed to avoid any reference at all to Paine, despite the fact that one chapter was dedicated to a lengthy discussion of Paine’s friend and supporter, Benjamin Franklin, whilst another included an extended paean to Paine’s nemesis

title: Incidentally, we would be remiss to assume that ideas of ‘global citizenship’ were entirely beyond the pale in the 1960s. Revealingly, when plans were underway in 1964 to establish a memorial to Winston Churchill (what would later be Churchill College) more than one supporter asserted that the real significance of the great war leader lay in the fact that he was a ‘citizen of the world’
